means: （使）打滚( roll的第三人称单数 )
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 罗尔斯取自父名，来源于Roll,含义是“罗尔之子”(son of Roll)

sentence.Network_en: Their first car rolls off the production line on December 16.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的第一辆车于12月16日下线。

sentence.Network_en: Dena bought rolls of silk that seemed ridiculously cheap.
sentence.Network_cn: 德娜买了几卷看起来非常次的丝绸。

sentence.Network_en: Rolls Royce produces around 1,000 extremely desirable cars a year.
sentence.Network_cn: 劳斯莱斯公司每年生产约1,000辆非常吸引人的汽车。

entry.def: When something rolls or when you roll it, it moves along a surface, turning over many times.

example.ex: The ball rolled into the net...
example.tran: 球滚进了网中。

example.ex: Their car went off the road and rolled over...
example.tran: 他们的车冲出公路，翻倒在一旁。

entry.def: If you roll somewhere, you move on a surface while lying down, turning your body over and over, so that you are sometimes on your back, sometimes on your side, and sometimes on your front.

example.ex: When I was a little kid I rolled down a hill and broke my leg...
example.tran: 我小时候从一座山坡上滚了下来，把腿摔断了。

example.ex: They just rolled about on the floor punching each other like schoolboys...
example.tran: 他们像小学生一样，在地板上滚来滚去，互相挥着拳头揍对方。

entry.def: When vehicles roll along, they move along slowly.

example.ex: The lorry quietly rolled forward.
example.tran: 卡车静静地缓慢前行。

entry.def: If a machine rolls, it is operating.

example.ex: He slipped and fell on an airplane gangway as the cameras rolled...
example.tran: 在摄像时他不慎滑倒在飞机座位间的通道上。

example.ex: The newspaper presses are rolling in Pittsburgh again today.
example.tran: 今天，匹兹堡的报纸又开始印刷了。

entry.def: If drops of liquid roll down a surface, they move quickly down it.

example.ex: She looked at Ginny and tears rolled down her cheeks.
example.tran: 她看着金尼，泪水滑落脸庞。

entry.def: If you roll something flexible into a cylinder or a ball, you form it into a cylinder or a ball by wrapping it several times around itself or by shaping it between your hands.

example.ex: He took off his sweater, rolled it into a pillow and lay down on the grass...
example.tran: 他脱下毛衣，将它卷成一个枕头，然后在草地上躺了下来。

example.ex: He rolled and lit another cigarette.
example.tran: 他又卷了一支烟并点着了。

entry.def: A roll of paper, plastic, cloth, or wire is a long piece of it that has been wrapped many times around itself or around a tube.

example.ex: The photographers had already shot a dozen rolls of film.
example.tran: 摄影师们已经照了一打胶卷了。

example.ex: ...a roll of blue insulated wire.
example.tran: 一卷蓝色的绝缘电线

entry.def: If you roll up something such as a car window or a blind, you cause it to move upwards by turning a handle. If you roll it down, you cause it to move downwards by turning a handle.

example.ex: In mid-afternoon, shopkeepers began to roll down their shutters...
example.tran: 下午三时左右，店主们开始放下百叶窗。

example.ex: She rolled up the window and drove on...
example.tran: 她把车窗摇上来，继续开车。

entry.tran: 转动(眼睛)；(眼珠)骨碌碌地转
entry.def: If you roll your eyes or if your eyes roll, they move round and upwards. People sometimes roll their eyes when they are frightened, bored, or annoyed.

example.ex: People may roll their eyes and talk about overprotective, interfering grandmothers...
example.tran: 人们可能会翻着白眼谈论那些溺爱儿孙、样样都要插手的祖母。

example.ex: His eyes rolled and he sobbed.
example.tran: 他转了转眼睛，呜咽起来。

entry.def: A roll is a small piece of bread that is round or long and is made to be eaten by one person. Rolls can be eaten plain, with butter, or with a filling.

example.ex: He spread butter on a roll.
example.tran: 他把黄油抹在小圆面包上。

entry.tran: （鼓的）咚咚声,隆隆声,持续的轰鸣声
entry.def: A roll of drums is a long, low, fairly loud sound made by drums.

example.ex: As the town clock struck two, they heard the roll of drums.
example.tran: 当小镇的时钟敲响两点钟时，他们听到了隆隆的鼓声。

entry.def: A roll is an official list of people's names.

example.ex: ...the electoral roll.
example.tran: 选民名单

entry.def: If someone is on a roll, they are having great success which seems likely to continue.

example.ex: I made a name for myself and I was on a roll, I couldn't see anything going wrong.
example.tran: 我靠自己的能力成名了，接二连三地获得成功，我觉得一切似乎一帆风顺。

entry.def: If you say roll on something, you mean that you would like it to come soon, because you are looking forward to it.

example.ex: Roll on the day someone develops an effective vaccine against malaria.
example.tran: 盼望有一天有人会研制出一种能有效预防疟疾的疫苗。

entry.def: If something is several things rolled into one, it combines the main features or qualities of those things.

example.ex: Experts claimed that teachers had to be Einstein, Marie Curie and Linford Christie rolled into one to help children grasp the new national curriculum...
example.tran: 专家们称老师必须集爱因斯坦、居里夫人和林弗德·克里斯蒂的本领于一身，才能帮助孩子们掌握新的国家课程大纲。

example.ex: This is our kitchen, sitting and dining room all rolled into one.
example.tran: 这既是我们的厨房，又是客厅和餐厅。

auth_sentence.content: Mr Mak smiles as he rolls back his sleeves.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Mak smiles as he rolls back his sleeves.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Mak smiles as he rolls back his sleeves.

auth_sentence.content: The granny tax and sausage rolls are a sideshow.
auth_sentence.res_content: The granny tax and sausage rolls are a sideshow.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The granny tax and sausage rolls are a sideshow.

auth_sentence.content: They're not happy, and shit rolls downhill.
auth_sentence.res_content: They're not happy, and shit rolls downhill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They're not happy, and shit rolls downhill.

Sentence.sentence: It was a method of refrigeration which rolls from his work in low temperature physics.
